questions.question: Are there two female figures present in the image?
questions.explanation: In Image B, there is only one female figure standing in a red saree. There is no indication of a second female figure present.

questions.question: Are the two figures positioned symmetrically relative to the central axis of the image?
questions.explanation: Image B features only one female figure positioned centrally in front of the Taj Mahal depiction, so there are no two figures to position symmetrically.

questions.question: Is there a large central dome visible at the end of the pathway?
questions.explanation: Image B depicts the Taj Mahal, which is known for its large central dome visible at the end of the water channel in the representation.

questions.question: Is there an arched stone entrance framing the view of the central structure?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the depiction of the Taj Mahal does not include an arched stone entrance framing the building; instead, the structure itself is directly depicted behind the female figure without such framing.

questions.question: Is there a straight water channel running from the foreground to the central structure?
questions.explanation: Image B shows a stylized path leading towards the Taj Mahal which resembles a straight water channel with peacocks and flowers situated around it.

questions.question: Do the sarees retain a dominant red and gold color scheme?
questions.explanation: The saree worn by the single figure in Image B prominently features a red color with gold accents, maintaining the red and gold color scheme.

questions.question: Are gold jewelry pieces, including a forehead ornament (maang tikka) and earrings, visible on both figures?
questions.explanation: Image B shows only one female figure and she is depicted with earrings, but not with a maang tikka (forehead ornament). Therefore, both items aren't visible.

questions.question: Do both figures have long, dark hair?
questions.explanation: Image B presents a single female figure with long, dark hair, but there aren't two figures to compare hair length.
